intro: Jacquemontia violacea var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the glabrous blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features heart-shaped, hairy leaves that are typically green with a slight waxy coating. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple, opening in the morning and closing by midday. The varietal form, glabriuscula, is distinguished by its reduced hair coverage compared to the typical variety.
